Articles.Content:
Hi,

I have a problem with the STS-88. I not have liquid fuel when i eject the big fuel tank. But I'm on KSP 1.3. I'm succeed to put in orbit Zarya but I'm blocked now

In your video when you eject the big fuel tank, your engines MK-55 have full fuel ! Bug or the video have been made with another craft ? I have the same problem with the empty shuttle.

Edited September 3, 2017 by sylneo

5 hours ago, sylneo said:

Hi,

I have a problem with the STS-88. I not have liquid fuel when i eject the big fuel tank. But I'm on KSP 1.3. I'm succeed to put in orbit Zarya but I'm blocked now

In your video when you eject the big fuel tank, your engines MK-55 have full fuel ! Bug or the video have been made with another craft ? I have the same problem with the empty shuttle.

Ah I think there is an action group to enable crossfeed on a docking port clipped inside the shuttle to feed the OMS engines

23 hours ago, selfish_meme said:

Ah I think there is an action group to enable crossfeed on a docking port clipped inside the shuttle to feed the OMS engines

Thanks, I'm novice in KSP and I not understand the goal of action group. Now as I can see for the shuttle, I understand why it exist. For example for the brakes... brakes all the gears and on the tail fin. Your craft are very good designed. Good Job

44 minutes ago, sylneo said:

Thanks, I'm novice in KSP and I not understand the goal of action group. Now as I can see for the shuttle, I understand why it exist. For example for the brakes... brakes all the gears and on the tail fin. Your craft are very good designed. Good Job

Thank you, it was built in an older version of KSP so if you have any more issues let me know and I will see if I can fix them.
Do you plan to make other parts of ISS ?

30 minutes ago, sylneo said:

Do you plan to make other parts of ISS ?

@sgt_flyer has not been playing for awhile and I think we have both burned out on this abit, I have a craft file of the entire ISS if you want to go to the effort of splitting it up and launching it. The entire thing is 1032 parts, plus whatever you need to add to dock it. If you try and launch the entire thing as one it will blow up after a while, but seems stable enough if launched in parts.

1 hour ago, selfish_meme said:

@sgt_flyer has not been playing for awhile and I think we have both burned out on this abit, I have a craft file of the entire ISS if you want to go to the effort of splitting it up and launching it. The entire thing is 1032 parts, plus whatever you need to add to dock it. If you try and launch the entire thing as one it will blow up after a while, but seems stable enough if launched in parts.

Oh yes I want it ! Except if you ever put a link on the first but it not seems to me. I'm playing also with the ISS of Adam if you know it (Adam's Stock International Space Station). I think it's a similar project but he not use the canadarm. But I prefer the design and the working of your craft + canadarm.

Hello - i don't know if the canadarm and the soyouz still works correctly with the latest builds - the geometry of some parts (the mono RCS for example, which i used in the hinges), and the monoprop engine) has changed. 

For the soyuz for example, the monoprop engines were used at the tip of the side boosters during separation - the new model of the monoprop engine is way bigger than the old one, which makes separation quite risky.
Just reminiscing over some of the stuff @sgt_flyer built
I might add this to the pack when it's finished
